result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenin Leondra Stewart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kenin Leondra Stewart is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kenin Leondra Stewart was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park, Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.
  • Kenin Leondra Stewart was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Kenin Leondra Stewart was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To be paid as a condition of probation

To follow all rules and conditions of probation. To undergo all assessments/treatments prescribed. 

To pay costs of extended supervision as a condition of probation.

To pay costs of Charges 3 and 4 in case 14CF67, totaling $586.00, as a condition of probation.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs of action at rate of 25% of all prison funds and earnings during extended supervision.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay court cost and cost of supervision during probation. $300 cash bond applied.

May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician presently treating the defendant.  May not posssess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to undergo any treatment or counseling the agent deems appropriate.
Defendant to undergo any other treatment or counseling the agent deems appropriate.

supervisions.notes:
May be served under the Huber Law as long as the defendant reports and remains alcohol and controlled substance free.
Concurrent with: any other sentence

Same conditions and terms as in Count # 3.
Concurrent with: count # 3.

May be served under the Huber Law as long as the defendant reports and remains alcohol and controlled substance free.
Concurrent with: any other sentence

Kenin Leondra Stewart, defendant appeared in Court in custody with counsel Peter A. Bartelt.
Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney.  Kenin Leondra Stewart appeared by video means with Attorney. Probation revoked, sentence imposed. Defendant sentenced on count 1 (previously revoked and sentenced in coutns 3 and 4)
Count 1: 2 years initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision, credit for 208 days previously served. Pay costs of action at rate of 25% of all prison funds and earnings during extended supervision. Eligible for substance abuse program and challenge incarceration program.

Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 5, 2021 at 02:00 pm.
